goals.title: Better Sleep
goals.description: The keystone habit that affects everything else
goals.researchSummary: Quality sleep is foundational for cognitive function, emotional regulation, immune health, and overall well-being. Poor sleep affects every aspect of life.

commonConcerns.response: Start with a simple wind-down routine 30 minutes before bed. Even basic changes can significantly improve sleep quality.

goals.title: Get Moving
goals.researchSummary: Regular movement and exercise improve cardiovascular health, mental well-being, cognitive function, and longevity. Even light activity provides significant benefits.

commonConcerns.concern: I don't have time for long workouts
commonConcerns.response: Start with just 5-10 minutes of walking or stretching. Small amounts of movement still provide meaningful health benefits.

goals.title: Feel Better
goals.description: Mood and mental wellness for immediate wins
goals.researchSummary: Simple practices like gratitude, breathing exercises, and positive social connections provide immediate mood benefits and build long-term emotional resilience.

commonConcerns.concern: I feel overwhelmed and don't know where to start
commonConcerns.response: Start with one small practice like writing down 3 things you're grateful for. Small wins build momentum.
